Prior Medication : Required : At least two week conventional dose regimen antidiarrheal medication ( e.g . : Lomotil , Imodium , Paregoric ) within one month prior study entry . OR Patients evidence upper low GI infection ( ) approve , potentially curative therapy must fail appropriate treatment least two week . Exclusion Criteria Coexisting Condition : Patients follow condition symptom exclude : Evidence underlie immunosuppressive disease due HIV . Diarrhea cause know gastrointestinal disorder idiopathic ulcerative colitis , Crohn 's disease , acute stool culture positive bacterial colitis ( document within last 2 week prior study entry AND least 2 week antibiotic therapy ) , pseudomembranous colitis ( Clostridium difficile toxin positive ) , short gut syndrome , chronic pancreatitis ( alcoholic idiopathic ) , ischemic bowel disease , enteroenteric fistula .
